column1: The Purple Pig////The pork tongue is served in thin delicate slices with a creamy white sauce. The tongue was so tender
column2: and had a real smoky/peppery flavor I Â loved. The crispy pig's ear was also tasty. I've had cold pig ear before
column3: but this was my first time trying it fried and I loved it. Almost like onion strings but way better. The lamb's rib was HUGE! We couldn't finish it all
column4: but no less tasty. It was fall-off-the-bone tender. And we can't forget the caviar and ice cream. Served on this wafer thin waffle fry chip
column5: it was gorgeous and tasted as good as it looked. The ice cream was whipped to perfection and made a nice compliment to the salty caviar.
